column5: My son and I will be crossing for a fishing trip next month and I was wondering if there are any special requirements to take my son across due to divorce? He does have a passport. Also, what is the best time of day to cross at International Falls? Thanks
You need a noterized letter from his mother giving permission. See previous posts. There has been a couple topics about this.
Best time of day in my past experiences was as soon as you could get there. If you get there after 7:00 a.m. you might as well go get something to eat and wait for the rush to end.
We usually cross at International Falls before noon on Friday and have no problem. We usually arrive there between 10:30 and 11:30.

The camp operators we're staying with sent us a bunch of information on this even though the child situation does not apply to us. What they said was to get a notarized letter (as jigman suggested) from the other parent, and the more detail it contains about such things as dates, destinations, etc., the better, i.e., "johnny has my permission to enter Canada with (name) on (date) and travel to and stay at Bigfish Lodge on Whopper Lake from (date) to (date)", etc. Maybe all that detail is overkill but that is what they suggested to us. Good luck to you. I wish my dad would have taken me to Canada fishing when I was a kid. But now I'm taking him to Canada fishing while he's retired!
